column5: Got back from a great day at Smokey's today. started fishing around 9am after getting set up in the hut and everything. as soon as i got my spreader to the bottom i had a fish on...didn't get it up, but a good start to the day none the less. about ten minutes later and we've already missed 3 fish. then i finally get one up...about a 4-5 lb whitefish, my first whitefish. and while i was fighting that, my brother hooked one as well, he missed that one. after untangling the lines that were stuck from the fight, we get our lines back down...as soon as mine hits the bottom, i've got another fish on, this time a 4 lb lake trout. all of this action was between 9 and 10:30am. after that fish, we didn't have much action until my dad pulled in a nice 5 lb lake trout at about 2:30. and that was all we got for the rest of the day, we left the lake just after 4pm. from 10:30 - 2:30 we had sporadic hits, but nothing stuck around long enough to get a hook set.
well done guys...thats a great catch for the day,and everyone had fun....and they look tasty from here,they are all nice size fish too...cheers
MMMMMMMMMMmmmmmmmmm. yummy...nice fish.good pics. Thanks for sharing
Heck, a report with fish in it! Great stuff gone fishin and that dinner pic sure beats the pasta we had tonight!
Beauty fish!  Looks like it was a fun day.  I think pops' laker takes the cake.  Good work!
Great report.  Gosh that looks tasty.  Thanks.  Joey
Nice report, Hoping my next will be like yours.   dsn
Good stuff, first time this year I've seen a whitefish come out of Simcoe, good to know they're there and hungry  Maureen
Super report!   I got to get out there one of these days real soon and get a few white fish.
nice fish looks like it was fun

Awsome, looks like it was fun. I was out with my father and Snagmasteral yesterday with no luck at all. The weather started to turn, wind gusts up to 50kph, so it made it a little uncomfortable to sit out there without a hut. What depth were you fishing?
Congrats on your outting!  Great report too!

we were in 80FOW. i had my fishfinder there, we were marking fish all day long. marked some suspended smelt and possibly small herring at about 40 - 50 feet. all of the lakers and whities were within 3 or 4 feet of bottom.
Good job and nice fish. I think that the warm weather turned the fish on yesterday. Cheers Jeff
